event.description:
Hi everyone today I am going to share with you,
Why Holi is popular….

It all started with a story.

A story about Good vs bad, that changed our attitude about colours.

So let’s jump right into it.

Prahlad was a devotee of Lord Vishnu.

But Prahlad’s father, Dainik Raj Hiranyakashap was atheist and nirakusha.

He asked his son Prahlada to leave Vishnu worship, but Prahalad did not give up his Vishnu devotion.

After this, Hiranyakashyap decided to kill him by looking at the devotion of his son Prahalad.

But all the efforts of Hiranyakashyap could not be successful.

After this, Hiranyakaship entrusted this work to his sister Holika.

The sister of Hiranyakashyap received a boon that she could never burn in the fire.

So, on the orders of Hiranyakashyap, Holika Prahlad sat on the burning fire.
The holika got burnt after sitting in the fire, but Prahalad survived.

Therefore, Holi is celebrated on this day in remembrance of Prahlad.

Prahlad means happiness. The symbol of hostility and persecution that burns (burning wood) burns, the Prahalad (Anand) symbol of love and joy is intact. That’s why this festival is celebrated.

Now you know why holi is celebrated,

So you may also want to celebrate Holi with your family and friends.

And the best way of starting your Holi, is by wishing your close peoples by wishing them with some of the best Happy Holi WhatsApp Messages.

Well ok then, thank you for spending your valuable time on my post hope you liked it.

See you next time, till then
